alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 10:56PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Comanche, northwestern Garvin, Grady, southeastern Caddo, west central Cleveland and McClain Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1056 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pocasset to 4 miles southeast of Chickasha to 6 miles northwest of Marlow. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Western Norman, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Anadarko, Lindsay, Elgin, Goldsby, Apache, Rush Springs, Fletcher, Cyril, Dibble, Sterling, Fort Cobb, Washington, Cole, Alex, Verden, and Cement. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 99 and 108. Interstate 44 between mile markers 49 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
